# Stencil with Storybook Starter Pack

This is a starter project for building a project UI library using Stencil with Storybook .

Stencil is also great for building entire apps. For that, use the [stencil-app-starter](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil-app-starter) instead.

## Getting Started

To start building a new project or library UI using Stencil and Storybook, clone this repo to a new directory:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/rbernalber/stenbook.git
cd stenbook
git remote rm origin
```

and run:

```bash
npm install
npm story
```

To build the component for production, run:

```bash
npm run build
```

To run the unit tests for the components, run:

```bash
npm test
```

Need help? Check out our docs [here](https://stenciljs.com/docs/my-first-component).

## Naming Components

When creating new component tags, we recommend _not_ using `stencil` in the component name (ex: `<stencil-datepicker>`). This is because the generated component has little to nothing to do with Stencil; it's just a web component!

Instead, use a prefix that fits your company or any name for a group of related components. For example, all of the Ionic generated web components use the prefix `ion`.
